page.title: 08Courteenhall A Baronet's Day
page.content: This typical day in July '85 commenced with office work. Usually Lady Wake and he receive about 25 letters a day. The remainder of the morning was spent at the Royal Agricultural Show at Stoneleigh. During the afternoon a vist with the Farm Manager was made to Blenheim Palace to view greenhouses with a view to possibly purchasing a similar make for the Gardens at Courteenhall. At 5.30pm a meeting took place with the land agent of Lamport Hall Estate of which Sir Hereward is Chairman of the trustees. At 7.00pm Sir Hereward chaired a meeting of the Courteenhall Parochial Church Council which lasted approx. one hour. Most days include meetings re: the Estate or the many organizations and socities in which he is actively involved. Often engagements include his official role of Vice Lord Lt for N'tonshire.
